description: 'Leon, I am your father.' - Billy Birkin, probably

0.1.description: Use the attached apworld and YAML file with your normal Archipelago install to generate a randomized world for Resident Evil 2 Remake.
0.1.title: Initial release

0.1.1.description: This release adds a couple "soft start" options to help players ease into RE2R randomizer with some item assistance.
0.1.1.title: Adding soft start options

0.1.2.description: This release fixes a couple bugs related to gaps in the item pool, and handling non-randomized items better.
0.1.2.title: Fixed item pool bugs

0.1.3.description: Dispersal Cartridge check wasn't triggering correctly so, in the meantime, making it non-randomized to prevent issues.
0.1.3.title: Making Dispersal Cartridge not randomized

0.1.4.description: There was a location in Morgue and one in the Bioreactors Room that weren't properly accounted for, so updated those.
0.1.4.title: Added a couple missing or misidentified locations

0.1.5.description:
This apworld release includes the following fixes:

- T-Bar Handle is now vanilla to avoid a hardlock when used at Secret Room before entering Sewers
- Boxed Electronic Part 2 is now vanilla to avoid a hardlock when viewing the Clock Tower cutscene past the G2 fight
- King Plug is now vanilla to avoid a hardlock when visiting Bottom Waterway after completing the G2 fight
- General Staff and Senior Staff chips are now wristbands to prevent a hardlock when the ID bracelet is upgraded prior to opening the front door of Labs
0.1.5.title: Fixing issues from first day of Alpha

0.1.6.description:
This apworld release fixes a bug where the Clock Tower would give you the wrong Boxed Electronic Part, even though it said it was the right one.

Additionally, I didn't want this to just be a single fix release, so I added a couple YAML options to play with. Have fun! :)
0.1.6.title: Electronic Part fix, adding some weapon YAML options

0.1.7.description:
This apworld release includes the following:

- Fixed a bug where the Trophy was the B scenario one, not A scenario
- Fix for collecting blue herb in Greenhouse
- Senior Staff wristband is now in the chip's vanilla location to prevent a hardlock
- Supply Closet in East Hallway was renamed to make it easier to find
- Fix for red herb at Helicopter being in logic too early
- Added options for extra key items for RPD exit and Clock Tower event
- Added Single Use Rockets for rockets only mode to make it more interesting/challenging
- Added apworld version to spoiler log
0.1.7.title: Labs and Trophy fixes, options for less BK, balancing rockets

0.2.0.description:
This apworld release includes the following:

- Support for the Claire A, Leon A, and Claire B scenarios, courtesy of Solidus!
- Support for Hardcore difficulty across all 4 scenarios
- Added a YAML option that prevents randomized progression from being in Labs (now the default)
- Added YAML options to remove healing items and gunpowder from the pool for challenge runs
- Fixed a bug where the plug puzzle in Bottom Waterway didn't logically require Queen Plug
- Fixed a bug where the downed employee in Greenhouse didn't logically require Signal Modulator
- Added the 2 locations unlocked by Hiding Place film (they're not randomized)
0.2.0.title: Added all Scenarios and Hardcore

0.2.1.description:
This release adds optional weapon randomization from all weapons in all scenarios, with various options to customize what should be randomized (including starting weapon). Weapon rando also affects the pre-existing Bonus Start YAML option.

Additionally, a number of other additions or fixes were included:

- Progression items in all scenarios now have item groups for easier hinting
- A scenarios will now open the East Hallway shutter after the first Marvin cutscene to allow revisiting early East Hallway
  - This also removes the Fuse - Main Hall from the item pool in A scenarios
- B scenarios are now guaranteed to have a weapon early on that has has usable ammo
- Locations in both A scenarios, around Shower Room, now have better naming
- Claire scenarios now have an Orphanage typewriter teleport available
- Spare Key 1 and 2 is now condensed into a single "Spare Key" item
- All Safety Deposit Room lockers now require both Spare Keys to be in logic
- Fixed a bug in Claire scenarios where locations after Chief's Room were in logic too early
- Fix a bug in Claire scenarios where Red Herb after Helicopter was in logic too early
0.2.1.title: Cross-Scenario Weapon Rando and Various Fixes

0.2.2.description:
This release includes a couple bug fixes:

- Fuse and Bolt Cutters will no longer show up before the first Marvin cutscene, which prevents a softlock
- Fix for receiving the wrong Trophy item in A/B scenarios

**Note:** Be sure to always update your client and apworld together. In a lot of cases, newer apworlds won't work with older clients, and vice versa.
0.2.2.title: Beta bug fixes

0.2.3.description:
This release adds DeathLink, adds Poison and Damage traps, and updates the APWorld to be compatible with changes in Archipelago version 0.5.0.

Other new features in this release:

- The "Extra Medallions" and "Extra Clock Tower Items" options now default to on for a smoother first-time experience
- The Main Hall Fuse in B scenarios is now a local item to prevent very early BK

Additionally, this release includes a number of bug fixes:

- Fixed a variety of issues with weapon rando, including some issues when multiple players are using weapon rando
- Fixed logic bugs related to RPD 3F, which should resolve recent Universal Tracker issues
- Fixed issues with some options needing to replace filler but not having enough filler to replace
- Fixed issues similar to the above for B scenarios and the large-caliber ammo
- Fixed a bug in the "Allow Progression in Labs" option that may have allowed Progression Skip Balancing items, like McGuffins
0.2.3.title: Deathlink, Traps, and support for AP 0.5.0

0.2.4.description:
This release adds ammo pack quantity modification/randomization, adds the remaining Hiding Place locations and randomizes all of them (@JustNU), and fixes a number of logic problems in RPD.

Other new features in this release:

- New YAML option for Hardcore campaigns: "Starting Ink Ribbons"
- The Rookie Desk item in RPD's West Office is now randomized
- The T-Bar Handle in Sewer's Treatment Room is now randomized, and will not be randomized beyond Sewers
- Sewers Key will no longer be randomized beyond Sewers, preventing chains that could lead to the Sewers softlock
- The option to avoid progression in Labs now supports the absurd Progression + Useful item classification used by some games
- Added the MQ11 upgrade for Claire campaigns

Additionally, this release includes a number of bug fixes:

- Duplicate regions during generation of B side campaigns
- Various issues when preventing items from being placed in certain locations or areas to prevent softlocks
- Weapon randomizer not properly including the starting weapon's upgrades
- RPD Roof's Helicopter Crash item being in logic before Parking Garage is accessible
- Lounge - RPD connections to Library and STARS Hallway in RPD
- Logical requirements to access Secret Room, which no longer requires Bolt Cutters
- RPD's Roof (in LA/LB) only being logically accessible with Square Crank (now is in logic with Jack Handle too)
- RPD's Roof (in CA/CB) requiring Jack Handle when it should be accessible with Diamond and Heart Keys
- RPD's Interrogation Room (LA/LB) only being logically accessible with Square Crank (now is in logic with Jack Handle too) 
- RPD Roof and Interrogation/Observation rooms now requiring items to return to RPD to be in logic for their respective campaigns
- Annette's wristband being in logic too early in Labs in Claire campaigns
- Mismatch with a couple of Leon's film items
- Hip pouches option total exceeding the maximum number of pouches
- General Python 3.12 compatibility
0.2.4.title: Ammo Quantity Randomization and Various Fixes

0.2.5.description:
This smaller release mainly aims to fix a couple of important bugs that were found since the last release.

Included in this release:

- Various fixes for Spare Keys and the Safety Deposit Room lockers that would require them
- Fix for Claire scenarios' Sewer regions putting Upper Waterway in logic before receiving T-Bar Handle
- Fix for B scenarios' Hiding Place location in Press Room being put in logic before receiving Main Hall fuse
- Renaming locations so they are more easily identified for tracking purposes (@dontjoome)
- YAML option to mark the 3 RPD medallions as "early" items, so they are guaranteed to show up in sphere 1
0.2.5.title: Bug fixes for the holidays

0.2.6.description:
It's been a while since a release, and this one is PACKED with updates. Chess plugs are fixed, some important options bugs were fixed, and a number of other improvements and bug fixes were added!

**Major bug fixes:**
- Fixed the "Progression in Labs" option
- Fixed the "Early Medallions" option
- Fixed a bug where the "Troll" setting of weapon rando was removing all weapons, and not just some weapons
- Fixed a bug where Joint Plug could show up at G5 in Claire scenarios (@TheRealSolidusSnake)
- Fixed a bug with Square Crank showing up on Roof/Boiler Room in Leon scenarios, since it's required to leave Parking Garage logically

**More updates:**
- "Oops All Miniguns" option added, with similar effect to other "Oops All" options (@wcolding) 
- Added a harder "Troll Starting" setting to weapon rando, for people that enjoy not receiving weapons
- Film items are no longer progression, except for the Hiding Place film
- Assisted is now a supported difficulty
- Bonus Start option now also includes a few Grenades and Flashbangs
- Dispersal Cartridge in Labs is now randomized (@TheRealSolidusSnake)
- Valve Handle is now logically required to finish the game (@TheRealSolidusSnake)  

**More bug fixes:**
- Fixes to Leon's Sewers logic in both scenarios (@TheRealSolidusSnake)
- Various locations were renamed for consistency, and to resolve a few bugs (@TheRealSolidusSnake) 
- Minor fix for B scenarios having 1 extra item in the item pool
0.2.6.title: Chess Plug and Progression in Labs fixes

0.2.7.description:
This smaller follow-up release fixes a couple of bugs that were introduced in 0.2.6 (detailed below), and makes a few Quality of Life adjustments to improve the overall experience.

**Major Bug Fixes:**
- Fixes a bug that prevented some chess plug panels on B scenarios from sending their checks properly

**Other Updates:**
- Prevents a knife from being randomized before East Hallway in A scenarios to encourage triggering Marvin's cutscene first
- There is now a guaranteed knife on the Break Room chair in B scenarios to assist with the G1 fight

**Minor Changes:**
- Option errors now throw an OptionError instead of a base Exception. (This will be unnoticeable to most players.)
0.2.7.title: Bugfixes and QoL changes

0.3.0.description:
It's been a while since the last update, so let's get a big release out to round out 2025!

**New features:**
- New YAML option to include enemy kills as locations (for Leon A Standard/Assisted only, currently)
- New YAML option for Starting Weapon
- Added support for YAML random when using Universal Tracker
- Added eventual AP 0.7.0 support

**Improvements:**
- Spade Key is now randomized in B scenarios
- Weapon rando ammo concentrations have been adjusted to diversify weapon usage more
- The "Oops!" family of options now eliminates gunpowder from the item pool
- The Early Medallions YAML option now defaults to on
- Bolt Cutters are now an early item when playing on Hardcore, in conjunction with the Main Hall shutter fix below
- Main Hall fuse can no longer be randomized behind the East Hallway 2F shutter in Leon B, reducing early BK
- The Trophy items are no longer progression

**Bug fixes:**
- The Main Hall shutter is no longer removed in Hardcore, preventing a potential softlock on death
- Fix for weapon rando having duplicate Quickdraw / M19 in B scenarios
- Various logic and naming changes, including fix for Chief's Office door in Claire scenarios (courtesy of @TheRealSolidusSnake)
0.3.0.title: Enemy Kills and Weapon Improvements

0.3.1.description:
A smaller release this time. This one fixes some recent bugs, including ones with Enemy Kills.

**In this release:**

- Logic fixes for Enemy Kills enemies, specifically around RPD 2 enemies
- Removed the Maiden Statue licker and hanging zombie in Sewers from Enemy Kills, as they spawn/die inconsistently
- If both Enemy Kills and Weapon Rando are on, and no fire weapons are rolled, Ivys become excluded/filler locations
- When Allow Prog. in Labs is on, Sewers Key is statically placed at the vanilla T-Bar location in Sewers now 
  - This is to prevent having to backtrack to Sewers after leaving for Labs

That's it for this one. Enjoy!
0.3.1.title: Fixes for Enemy Kills

0.3.2r2.description:
Details below!

**Enemy Kills**
- Added the remaining scenarios for Enemy Kills as Locations (thanks to Xefir, Nowhere, and Ropeyred in Discord!)
- Fixes to LAS Enemy Kills (thanks to the above for these as well!)
- Fixed a starting weapon bug with Enemy Kills where a starting fire weapon would still exclude Ivys

**Logic Fixes**
- Removed the "Fuse - Break Room Hallway" logical requirement for the RPD revisit
- Removed the "Rook Plug" logical requirement for progressing past the Rook Plug bridge in Sewers, since checking the location doesn't raise the bridge

**New Options**
- Added new YAML options for Local Weapons and Double Weapons, respectively

**Generic Fixes**
- Fixed "Troll" settings in Weapon Randomizer smoothing ammo when they shouldn't
- Template YAML no longer includes a minimum version
0.3.2r2.title: Autosaves and Enemy Kills scenarios
